Instrument_Host.name: Spitzer Space Telescope
Instrument_Host.description: The Spitzer Space Telescope was a 3-axis stabilized, pointing and scanning observatory in a solar, Earth-trailing orbit with three crogenically-cooled instruments operating from the near- to far-infrared. The telescope had an aperture of 85 cm, a diffraction limit of 5.5 microns, a field of view of ~5 arcmin x 5 arcmin for each band, a pointing stability of <0.1 arcsec, and a maximum tracking rate of 1.0 arcsec/sec. Its three instruments were the InfraRed Array Camera (IRAC), InfraRed Spectrograph (IRS), and Multiband Imaging Photometer for Spitzer (MIPS).
